snippet: It was the first time since the Syrian uprising began 13 months ago that the Security Council put its full weight behind a concrete proposal to stop the violence.
abstract: United Nations Security Council votes unanimously to send an advance team of up to 30 military observers to Syria to begin monitoring the tenuous cease-fire; it is the first time since the Syrian uprising began 13 months ago that the Security Council put its full weight behind a concrete proposal to stop the violence, with Russia and China joining the rest of the 15-member Council to authorize the observer mission.
lead_paragraph: It was the first time since the Syrian uprising began 13 months ago that the Security Council put its full weight behind a concrete proposal to stop the violence.

headline.seo: Amid Shaky Truce, U.N. Approves Observers for Syria
headline.main: U.N. Votes to Send Observers to Syria Amid a Shaky Truce
headline.print_headline: Security Council Votes to Send Observers to Syria
